page.title: 07A PADSTOW PART-TIME FIREMAN
page.content: I get up at about 7 o'clock and have my breakfast.At half past 8 I go to work.I am a builder and decorator with my own business but wherever I go I make sure that I have my pocket bleeper with me just in case there is a fire and I need to be contacted. At 10 o'clock I stop for a short break and then drive into Wadebridge to get some wood.Lunch is at 1 o'clock but, before I can start, the bleeper goes off and I rush to the new fire station, opened last year, and change into my uniform.I am the fire engine driver and we hurry to put out a gorse fire at St. Eval.I go back home to finish my lunch and then return to my work.After tea I go back to the station for Drill Practice from 6.45 until 9 o'clock.After Practice I go to the pub with the other firemen and return home at 10.30 and go to bed.
